text: Fadwa Soliman or Fadwa Suleiman (17 May 1970 â€“ 17 August 2017) was a Syrian actress and activist. She was born in Aleppo, Syria. She led a Sunni-majority protest against Bashar al-Assad's government in Homs.Basma Atassi (23 November 2011) "Q&A;: Syria's daring actress", Al Jazeera. She became one of the most recognized faces of the Syrian Civil War.Khaled Yacoub Oweis (5 January 2012) "Syrian actress treads new stage in Syrian protests" , Reuters.Amrutha Gayathri (March 31, 2012) "Fadwa Suleiman: Actress And Alawite Icon Of Syrian Revolt Warns Of Sectarian Violence", International Business Times. On 17 August 2017 Soliman died of cancer while in exile in Paris, aged 47. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1970 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in France Category:Syrian activists Category:Movie actors Category:Television actors Category:Voice actors Category:Syrian actors
title: Fadwa Soliman
